Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

description: A woman allegedly murdered her husband with her boyfriend's help by drugging his biryani with sleeping pills. After he became unconscious, the boyfriend reportedly suffocated him with a pillow while the wife assisted. The wife then falsely claimed he died of a heart attack, but post-mortem revealed suffocation, leading to their arrest.

Police have invoked the 2019 triple talaq law, along with provisions for rape and other offenses. The case highlights the legal complexities surrounding Muslim personal law and marriageable age.

title: 'Your captain is Hindu': Ex-India cricketer warns Bangladesh over shifting T20 WC matches
description: Former cricketer Atul Wassan urged Bangladesh to resolve tensions with India regarding the T20 World Cup 2026, suggesting Litton Das's captaincy as a bridge. He dismissed the BCB's request to shift matches as logistically impossible and impractical, emphasizing India's robust security. The ICC confirmed matches will remain in India, despite the BCB's continued stance.

Behind polished apps, corporate facades and reassuring payouts lies a carefully engineered cycle of trust, timing and collapse. Lavpreet Kaur examines how such frauds flourish amid regulatory gaps

title: How V.O. Chidambaram Pillai earned the title  ‘Sekkizhutha Chemmal’
description: VOC was arrested on the charge of sedition on March 12, 1908. A British jailer noticed his hands bleeding from the harsh labour of separating coir and spinning rope in the Coimbatore prison. Hence, he advised him to work at the oil press instead. VOC  accepted the suggestion and pulled the oil press himself, a task normally reserved for bulls

He quit the DMK in 1961 and founded a party, which he merged with the Congress. Sampath’s birth centenary falls on March 6, 2026.

description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s romance has inspired billions around the world with the love, respect and commitment they have shown towards each other.While there have been reports that their high profile wedding might have been delayed, it seems Taylor Swift is already working on a new thing. To make it more interesting, her new project will be heavily inspired by her relationship with Travis Kelce.

description: The Supreme Court has expedited the Bhojshala Saraswati Temple cum Maulana Kamal Maula Mosque dispute. Both Hindu and Muslim communities can now offer prayers simultaneously in demarcated areas. The court has lifted its stay on the Madhya Pradesh High Court proceedings. The ASI report will be unsealed and shared with both sides.

title: ‘Email not valid’: Kejriwal acquitted in ED summons case
description: A Delhi court has ruled that summons issued via email are not legally valid under CrPC or PMLA, acquitting Arvind Kejriwal for skipping Enforcement Directorate notices. The court found the ED failed to prove intentional disobedience, noting Kejriwal's status as a serving chief minister and his fundamental right to movement.

title: MHA notifies Census 2027 schedule, lists 33 questions
description: India's upcoming Census 2027 will collect detailed household information, including building materials, amenities like water and sanitation, and ownership status. For the first time since 1931, caste details will be gathered. The houselisting and housing phase runs April-September 2026, with population enumeration in February 2027.

title: Watch: Kim Jong Un’s softer side on display as he tours hot springs and luxury resorts
description: In a surprising turn, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un embraced a lighter moment during a visit to a newly refurbished hot springs resort alongside his daughter. The lavish mountain complex, boasting state-of-the-art facilities, is touted as a symbol of the country's advancement.

Instead of expressing sympathy, Trump chose to highlight the deceased's father's political views, prompting Thanedar to describe the President as a 'deranged sociopath.

title: Manipur horror: Meitei man abducted from Kuki fiancée’s house, killed on camera
description: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fiancée in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

Man quits high-paying job to become an auto driver
description: A former corporate employee, Rakesh Pal, left a high-paying job after facing manipulation, insecurity, and depression. He found his way back through weight loss and a modest gym trainer role, eventually buying an auto. Now, he drives for a living, prioritizing his well-being and happiness over a toxic corporate environment.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands of US employees
description: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization effort driven by AI. The consulting giant is also introducing a new 'leaders' designation for senior roles. This change aims to better align roles with responsibilities and clarify career paths, though day-to-day work and compensation remain unchanged.

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she’s coping with Chiefs’ tough season
description: The Kansas City Chiefs’ billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team’s side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Quote of the day: Patrick Mahomes on never losing hope in adverse times
description: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‘Maybe he’s realised what everyone is worried about’
description: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue move. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.
